p: Up to date, 64 mosquito species are recorded in Iran [ 1, 2] and several cryptic species have been identified using molecular tools [ 3, 4]. Mosquitoes of the main genera, Culex and Aedes are incriminated as the most important vectors of arboviruses [ 5, 6]. The increasing volume of people displacements including movements of refugees, and the traffic of goods and animals between countries of the region, offer multiple opportunities for arbovirus introduction in Iran such as dengue virus (DENV), and West Nile virus (WNV) [ 7, 8].
